intro: Macrolenes esetosa, commonly known as the hairy macrolene, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants such as cotton and hibiscus.
